data: The January afternoon was passing into night, the air was cold and still, so still that not a single twig of the naked beech-trees stirred; on the grass of the meadows lay a thin white rime, half frost, half snow; the firs stood out blackly against a steel-hued sky, and over the tallest of them hung a single star.
adventure|browsing: literature|browsing: science-fiction & fantasy|browsing: fiction|category: adventure|category: novels
